reviews_data.review_text: My first time swinging through to eat lunch while my son was refereeing soccer. Great food great service and a fun atmosphere.  I got some chicken curry with potato and carrot and a mango green tea.
Each individual food stall is incredible! Each unique and delicious.  I absolutely love this place!!!

Alley 51 Food Court is the perfect spot for a convenient and satisfying dining experience! Whether you're grocery shopping at G-Mart or just out for a quick meal, it's incredibly convenient to grab a bite right after you pick up your essentials. The variety of food options available at the food court ensures there's something for everyone, from tasty snacks to hearty meals.

The best part is how easy it is to combine your shopping and dining in one trip. After picking up groceries at G-Mart, you can head straight to the food court and enjoy a delicious meal without having to go out of your way. It's a great spot for a quick lunch or a relaxed dinner after a busy shopping day. Highly recommend checking it out if you're in the area!

OMG!! Love this place!!! My family does too! Amazing Clean Positive Family atmosphere. Every food booth owners/ workers are all polite and outgoing. Customer service is everything (patience, no rush). Ramen booth as soon as you walk in: good. Around the corner from there; Chinese booth: Roast duck is good (according to Hubby). Diagonally across from there serves Bomb Boba as the line is always worth the wait. Toward the bad... Mocha donuts: good and "my" FAVORITE out of all is the True Lao/Thai food; the closest thing I could get from home away from home. Would Highly recommend to all and my return is once a month!!!!
Love the whole place! Family friendly and more choices than you know what to do with

I live in South carolina, and I drive an entire 2 and a half hours to come to this place. I get all my groceries from next door and head here for some of the best Asian restaurants. The Kimbap and teobokki have me in  choke hold!
i went to the honey buns cafe since it was one of the cheaper options that had vegetarian stuff i liked and it was so good!! the portion was huge and it only took a few minutes for my food to be made

I bought 2 order of Siomai 4pcs each order at Honey buns Cafe 2, we did take out. As soon as me and my family get home and open to eat, theres only one order 5pcs inside instead of 2 order 8pcs.

My family are already hungry and excited to eat the siomai but we ended up challenging ourselves and split each one in a half for my whole family to eat.

They dont seem to understand the situation we live in the world and how scarce and expensive the food nowadays.

The staffs just didnt care about their costumers and trick them instead.
Yumi, the food was amazing. You can't go wrong with anything on that menu. The eel and soup were AMAZING! I'll definitely be back. Oh, and the donuts at Mochinuts were delicious.
Zona organizada, comida fresca y buena calidad.

I love coming here, there are so many options. I love Yume tho, it's so yummy! I've probably been there the most out of all the food options. Mochinut is also very good and they have good boba drinks as well.
The arcade here is pretty shit tho, half the machines don't work and the side with all the rhythm games is too loud to even hear the games, but I come here for the great food not the shit arcade.

Amazing food at :
Great Wall- Great Roast Duck and Amazing Kimchi Fried Rice (spicy).
HoneyBun 2 -has awesome peach green Boba tea with mango popping and passionfruit jelly.
Taewon- Best Korean Wagyu Bulgogi Smash Burger.

I went on a Tuesday and decided on Mukja a Korean place. I got the Chicken Curry Katsu and Fried Dumplings. Katsu 9/10 and dumplings 8/10. The dining area for Alley 51 is very playful and almost kid like. Reminded me of a school cafeteria. They have plenty of options to choose from if you like Thai, Vietnamese, and Korean food. They also have a lot of sweet spots like Mochinut that I lve only heard good things about. Note that some places are closed on certain days like Tuesday - Railay Express was closed which was our first pick. I will visit again to try them on another day!
Great spot / food hall, but there's not many options other than Asian food. (Which is fine). But surprised there was no Mexican cuisine, etc. Very cool spot though, nice outdoor seating too.

I went on a weekday afternoon, right before a snow "storm"  which is really not ideal. HOWEVER, the atmosphere was so calm and inviting.  The food that I was able to order was so fresh and tasty.  ALSO, the grocery store connect was the  (showing my age). I shopped for items I've seen only on YouTube and enjoyed the experience!
They have several different restaurants to choose from in a big food court setup. This place is my new favorite go to for Asian cuisine. There are lots of delicious options to choose from.
Top notch food court
So good!

1/28 update:
Gave this food court another shot and was disappointed again. We got the Bun (rice vermicelli) with grilled pork from Saigon Cafe and the rice noodles were a mushy overcooked mess. I asked for the noodles to be remade and the same thing happened so I requested a refund. I hope they can find a new cook or provide proper training on how to cook fresh rice noodles.

The other issue is they didn't include fresh cilantro, the bean sprouts weren't very fresh, and the pork was grisly and chewy. I don't think they cooked it at high enough heat because there wasn't a char on the meat.

...
Original review:

Tried it today for the first time and was disappointed with what we got.

Great Wall - had high hopes when we saw the hanging roast ducks and char siu pork hanging in the windows. But the duck skin wasn't crispy at all, had too much fat under the skin, and was served lukewarm. The marinated egg was so overcooked it was rubbery and inedible. The only decent part was the baby bok choy, that was cooked crisp tender (but also served lukewarm). Not worth $17.

Peking duck jianbing - this took about 15 minutes so I expected it to be piping hot. It wasn't lukewarm but it didn't taste like it was freshly made either. The thin slices of Peking duck were decent in tenderness and flavor but the amount was skimpy. The jianbing was full of fried wonton pieces and lettuce as filler. It was edible but not worth $15.

Mochinut - we got the original with sprinkles. It was really good. Not too sweet. Nice and chewy. $3.50 each. You pay at the kiosk and when they call your name, you tell them what flavor you want.
Not pictured but I also go the Thai wings , and the Korean croffle . And Thai tea .  Pictured is Filipino cuisine .  Halo halo and Sinigang.

My husband and I stumbled across this today when we decided to visit Super G's. I was on the hunt for dumplings and was so excited when I saw this was next door. The atmosphere is really fun, and there are tons of choices. We'll be back for sure!

If you're a lover of all types of Asian food; do yourself a favor and visit Alley 51! A short drive from Charlotte and downtown Pineville; this food hall offers a lot! From Indian, Thai, Mongolian, Vietnamese, Authentic Chinese, Japanese, and much more you're in for a treat. If you don't want to grab a hearty meal, there are a few dessert options that have your sweet tooth or activities to indulge in, like karaoke on certain nights, claw games, and gift shops. There is an international grocery store attached right to it.
Pricing from each restaurant varies, but out of the 3 restaurant I've tried, they're fairly priced for a considerable amount of food.
The seating is first come, first serve. However, there is plenty of seating even on a packed weekend.
All in all, this place is worth a try for anyone. Kids, adults, vegetarians, vegans, and meat eaters alike.

Hurray, an Asian food hall in Charlotte!

Large selection of sweet and savory options for meals or snacks!

A vibrant and bustling destination offering a wide variety of Asian cuisine, paired with the convenience of on-site grocery shopping. I'm giving it 3 stars, deducting one due to the limited vegetarian options--most vendors offer only one or two choices, while some have none at all, which is disappointing for plant-based diners. Another star is deducted for serving dine-in meals in disposable plastic containers, which significantly contributes to landfill waste and environmental degradation. Investing in sustainable servingware would greatly improve the dining experience. I'd gladly reconsider my rating if these issues are addressed.
Railay Express - Lo Mein

Review: A Culinary Gem - The Asian Food Court Experience

If you're a food lover like me, then an Asian food court is nothing short of a paradise. I recently had the pleasure of visiting one such food court, and I can confidently say it was a delightful culinary journey that left my taste buds dancing with joy.

Variety Beyond Compare

One of the standout features of this Asian food court is the incredible variety it offers. From tantalizing Thai curries and savory Vietnamese pho to delicious Chinese dumplings and fragrant Japanese ramen, there's something to satisfy every palate. Each stall presents an authentic taste of its respective culture, allowing diners to explore a myriad of flavors without the need for a passport!

Fresh Ingredients and Authentic Flavors

What impressed me the most was the emphasis on fresh ingredients. Each dish was vibrant, aromatic, and bursting with flavor. I sampled a bowl of steaming pho that was rich and savory, with a perfectly balanced broth that warmed my soul. The herbs and spices used in each dish were clearly of high quality, elevating the dining experience to a whole new level.

Affordable Indulgence

Another major advantage of the food court is affordability. In today's world, finding delicious food that won't break the bank can be a challenge, but this food court delivers. Each dish is reasonably priced, making it easy to try multiple items without feeling guilty. I found myself ordering a few small plates to share with friends, which added to the fun of the experience.

A Vibrant Atmosphere

The atmosphere of the food court was electric. It was buzzing with excitement, laughter, and the enticing sounds of sizzling woks and bubbling pots. The communal seating arrangement fostered a sense of community, allowing diners to strike up conversations and share their favorite dishes. This convivial environment enhances the overall experience, making each visit feel special.

Cultural Diversity

What truly sets this Asian food court apart is its celebration of cultural diversity. Each stall represents a different corner of Asia, showcasing not only the food but also the unique stories and traditions behind each cuisine. It's an opportunity to learn and appreciate the rich tapestry of flavors and culinary techniques that make Asian cuisine so beloved around the world.

Conclusion

In conclusion, my visit to the Asian food court was a delightful experience that exceeded my expectations. With its remarkable variety, fresh ingredients, affordability, vibrant atmosphere, and cultural richness, it's a destination that every food lover should explore. Whether you're a seasoned fan of Asian cuisine or a curious newcomer, the flavors and experiences waiting at this food court will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression. I can't wait to return and try even more dishes on my next visit!
Saigon Vietnamese cafe was awful. Ended up throwing away. Fried rice chicken tasted old/rotten. Noodles stir fry tasted off too.

No words can describe how much I love this place! The food is immaculate, and there is something for everyone from different countries of the asian region. Me and my family have had the delight to go almost weekly and try something new every time we go. Even if you don't want a big meal, they have multiple appetizers and small meals for a lighter dish. They seem expensive but you get your moneys worth. My wife and I love sharing meals, and when we don't want the same thing, we have delicious leftovers. Aside from foods and snacks, they also have arcade with rhythm games, claw machines, and surprise figures for adults and kids to enjoy. We have so much fun playing DDR and the Wacca games. For those with young kids, there is a play area to let those young ones roam around. The atmosphere is amazing. It has dim lighting that isn't too dark or too bright, which gives it a very welcoming and comfy feeling. The lines for food are orderly, and all areas of the place are kept clean and tidy. I have never been to an event area/dine hall with such clean bathrooms. For those with sensory issues, it can get a little rowdy and loud. I do recommend some headphones. They also have an outside area that is also comfy. Overall, I recommend this place for anyone and everyone who loves food and asian culture. Whether you come alone or with a large group of friends, it's an experience you can not miss out on!

Alley 51 is a great food hall. I tried multiple places and got stuffed.
Highly recommend checking it out. There are enough different options for all kinds of Asian food fans, hibachi, ramen, curry, Korean BBQ, even burgers with an Asian flair (bulgogi with kewpie mayo)
I was really disappointed with this food court. The food was just plain bad. We tried a few different places, but everything was just flavorless. Not worth the time or money.
Nice atmosphere with lots to try.  Some is a hit some is a miss.  The potato mozzarella kdog was my favorite.

Went to the Asian street food festival here. Located right next to Super G Mart in Pineville, NC. Had many different types of food to choose from : Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Thai, Vietnamese and the Philippines. Also visited a KPOP store and Anime store. Also saw a dragon dance. Enjoyed!
Great place with lots of selection!
Amazing selection of food

Awesome addition to pineville.  The food court is very diverse.  There are a lot of unique and fun foods to try.

They are located adjacent to and connected with the Super G Mart.

Neat place for everything Asian foods. Hard to pick because there are so many places. Walk around...
We enjoyed it
Plus a huge International food store next door.....super G mart...
An adventure!
The entryway should say OPEN, and Enter! Looks closed......
Lots of options!
pretty solid. kinda rough when they first opened up - but now it's a good spot with. lot of variety. some shops are expensive though
Great place!! Great options, good food, but it can get very busy sometimes. Would love if they added more arcade games
My go to place for anything asian....JUST FANTASTIC !!!
Fantastic! Several choices! Love the many options!

Asian restaurant complex located in the South Charlotte area. It has ample indoor and outdoor space, a play area for children and a great place to have lunch, dinner or stop to pick up some food to take home. Ample and free parking.
Perfecto lugar para ir en familia o amigos. La comida es muy rica.

Alley 51 is a fantastic spot in Charlotte that shows just how diverse the city is becoming. It's got a little bit of everything, which makes it the perfect place to grab a bite with friends or try something new. The variety of food options is amazing--whether you're in the mood for Asian street food, some Latin American favorites, or classic comfort food, they've got it all.

Each vendor brings their own twist, so there's always something new to check out, and the quality never disappoints. Plus, the vibe is super laid-back and fun, making it a great spot for a casual lunch or dinner. If you love having lots of choices and enjoy exploring different flavors, Alley 51 is definitely the place to be in Charlotte!

Absolutely love Alley 51 at the Super G Mart in Pineville, North Carolina! Such a fantastic idea! Was so great to walk around and check out all the different Asian food stalls! The only negative was there were so many choices. Everything I ate was absolutely delicious from Honeybuns to Great Wall! I also loved the Korean hotdog at Mochinut!! Such a great place to take people who are visiting! Will definitely go back!

What an awesome food market!! Attached to an international supermarket- this does not disappoint. Tons of unique options and open seating- great decor, a gaming area. Perfect for a friend outing or date night
A really cool food court! Check out Super G while you're here!

Alley 51 is a beautiful modern food hall specifically for Asian cuisine. The outside shopping center is super deceiving. Once you go inside it's actually really spacious and painted very cool colors and great open seating everywhere!  Bathrooms were great too. We tried many different restaurants. The cuisines included Thai, Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese, Chinese...all were delicious.  A definite must try!
Pork Bulgogi, Bao Buns, Dumplings - this place was UNBELIEVABLE - Asian Foodie Fans - this place is a must!!!
Great food.court style Asian food. Every kind of stall, so much variety. Everything we've ever explored there was delicious.

I'm not quite sure what the hype is all about. 8-10 dollar food they upcharge to 15 dollars without a drink or side. No sauces or seasoning. There are a few good choices here and there, but they need to chill with these price gouging. They refuse to offer water cups. I recommend shopping in the grocery store first and foremost, getting beverages, and then buying your sweets inside the grocery store instead of this overpriced food alley. I'm pretty sure I saw 4$ for can of soda. They also want a tip for everything.
Love that there are so many options!
Went here haven't try any food yet . Definitely be back to check it out
Awesome authentic Asian street food cafeteria! Definitely would go again! The only downside is it's a lil noisy but it's otherwise worth it!
Awesome food court of so many different cultures and tastes to try from. You can't go wrong with literally any restaurant in here

This international food hall has a rich variety of Asian cuisine, is family-friendly, and has the option to dine in or take out. The shrimp pho at Saigon Cafe was perfect (portion was enough to feed 2 people). Alley 51 is a great place for a delicious meal and then explore the Super G Mart with grocery options from across the globe, including the French-Asian bakery, Tous Les Jours. Will definitely be going back soon!
This place is very cool, tons of thing I want to try
Great food. Service depending on who is work at which stall.

Railey Spicy Beef!

Filipino spring rolls!

Mochi donuts!

Such a great place.  Food is great and a wonderful variety.  The lights however are so bright they cause headaches.  It's like an operating room.  Seating is better than it was but still a bit stiff.  Soften it to maximum experience.

This spot is bananas. Lots of different spots to choose from but not overwhelming. Lines can be somewhat long during busy times but they move pretty quickly. There is something for everyone here from dumplings, to egg rolls , to brisket and shrimp.
Great style. Big tables for family gatherings! Tables clean. Staff friendly. All the different Asian food you could choose from.....
I love to be there!great atmosphere.

We absolutely love going here!! Great food options, clean sitting space, great vibes, friendly people. Entertainment options for the entire family. I have never been during what might be a rush hour or busy time but the lines at some of the restaurants can get pretty long during regular times like 3pm on a Wednesday for example.

Some of the prices at some of the restaurants are kinda extreme but there are quite a few restaurants with different price points to fit every budget so just walk around a check it all out. The menus are displayed and equipped with prices. The workers at Great Wall were a bit rude one time so I've never eaten there. Yume is great, honey buns is great, Rai Lay (spell check) is great, and the Croffles from the croffle spot are delicious. Mochinut always has a long line Everytime I go so I assume they are great as well but I haven't had anything there personally.
This is an Asian Food court with about 10 or so offerings. Connected to the Super G mart. Plenty of parking/seating.
Lovely area!

What a nice surprise to find this place as we were grocery shopping at the GMart. So many options for Asian food, drinks, desserts. I love food halls. Everyone in the group gets what they want. There's plenty of seating.
Great variety of Asian kitchen
Honey bun cafe is my favorite place to goto!

A fantastic experience that lead from grocery shopping to the coolest international food section ever to the most epic food/arcade selection I've seen in some time!! The food options had Korean, Japanese, Mochidonut, and much more! A cool arcade with Japanese style rhythm games
Pricey food that for much of that seemed like gimmick food or just a one time experience kind of meal.
This is a fantastic food court with so many options. Great food and atmosphere.

Something different in Charlotte! So many food options in one place.. appetizers, entrees, desserts, drinks. You can try many things and enjoy your evening walking around and eating! Great for large groups too with outdoor seating options.

Okkkkk... first visit to this food hall. Interesting concept because all other food halls I've visited were a collection of different cultural cuisines. All of the spots in Alley 51 were Asian: Thai, Japanese, Korean, Chinese and more! And they have savory and sweet. So I tried the Pho Ga - traditional Vietnamese chicken soup - (because my fav mom and pop spot closed after the pandemic RIP!). It was a large portion, reasonably priced and had all the fixins: sprouts, basil, jalapenos, limes, cilantro and onions. Of course, I requested the hoisin and sriracha. Pho came out pipin hot! And it was fresh and good. Wish the broth had a bit more flavor but not bad. Service was great. The young lady walked me around the menu versus just asking what I wanted. I would go back and try something else there.
Interesting place to go

Went to honey buns and like always food is great. Got the veggie buns and a bbq pork bun as well as a Taiwan beef noodle. So many options of restaurants to choose from. There is also a small arcade area and a small kids area. Plenty of seating and small outdoor seating area. Overall nice experience.

I've visited twice and ate at the same place because Yuma and Sizzling Japanese food was so good! I then wanted to try Great Wall of China on my second visit but the two teens who were at the register were HORRIBLE. They stared at me and my friend and didn't say anything or move at all when I asked to buy  drinks. It was so weird, rude and awkward. They weren't doing anything at all. I thought it was just me but they treated my friend the same way. Not sure why they aren't working in the back. I advise everyone not to visit Great Wall of China. That kept me from giving 5 stars.
We will be back!

I've been to this place MUKJA a few times and their food is always top-notch. The pork katsu is perfectly crispy and the sauce is delicious. I recently tried their new Korean ribs and they were so well-marinated that I had to get an extra order to go. This Alley 51 spot has been for our Friday night dinners!

I tried the lumpia and BBQ skewer at the Manila restaurant and they were ready within about 2 minutes but the temperature was luke warm so that was a bit disappointing.  Got boba and a gochujuang bun at honeybuns.  Neither were that good.  I wish I had gotten Korean or Thai as they looked good, just more than I wanted to pay.  The sushi place and a few others had options to order on screens which was 

On a Thursday around 12, there were a decent amount of people here but didn't have to wait in line anywhere.  My toddler loved the kids' play area with a slide, connect 4, little table and nugget couch to jump on.  Family restroom  was hard to find (please put up restroom signs  )had a changing table and was spacious.  The food hall was quite clean overall and even had an arcade with Dance dance revolution and other games.

There is a little market section where you can buy snacks and drinks too.  Plenty of seating but signs indicated no outside food or drink was allowed.  Didn't see anyone policing that though.

Overall, you'll get better food elsewhere in my opinion but it's definitely worth a stop for the atmosphere and neat murals!
Finally made it here. So overwhelming, many things to select from. I really must. return.
Best pho I have had in a while!!! I highly recommend!
The food was awesome! Service was immaculate! Highly recommended

Excellent food hall!

Very clean, lots of options for both savory and sweet.
Very spacious lots of seats
Good AC
Very much well worth the travel!
Iteawon Bar and food - if you can take spice try their K-Spice Esquites

About me: I like Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Thai, and Vietnamese food and consider myself to be quite familiar with each. The good: The ambiance of the food court is nice. The bad: Price, better food quality found elsewhere, too busy. I truly wanted to like this place but I do not plan on returning.
I love it!
What gem and cool idea for Charlotte. International food, huge variety...very impressed. I will be back!

This place was just OK.  I think a lot of people are in love with the food hall concept causing the great reviews but Alley 51 doesnt deliver "amazing".  I had bao and shu mai from Honey Bun and it didnt knock my socks off.  Bland flavor and service was lackluster.  No dipping sauce except soy packets and duck sauce packets.  It was damn expensive and a water cup was $.75.  Also had the veggie lovers with tofu from the "Thai place".  Woked veggies with no flavor of thai....no ginger, no lemongrass and again expensive.   This place could be so much more and it fails to deliver the experience of an Optimist Hall or other food halls in the state.

Finally took the time out to visit alley 51 and it was worth it. I went on the 4th of July and it was not too crowded. I also ordered the beef spicy curry from the Thai restaurant and it was spicy just the way I like it and I want to come back soon and visit more places such as the mochinut.

The Food there is catered to the White American Palate. Nothing is seasoned the way Asians would eat it. We got roast duck, no flavor. Roast pork and bbq pork, no flavor. Dumplings, no good. Boba was so watered down we tossed it after a sip.

Asians beware.

When you walk in it's a bit overwhelming, really. Lots of options to pick from. A few Chinese joints, all different. Korean, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese, and I was quite surprised to see a Filipino spot. All the restaurants seemed reasonably priced. I hit up the steamed buns stall and got two buns and soda for about $10, which hit the spot for me. I figured Alley 51 would be good when I saw the crowd, and from the smells from all the different vendors that was pretty much confirmed. I'd come hungry and with a shopping list for the Super G Mart this place is attached to.

This is a food court. So far, I tried two of them. The taste of the food is OK. It's not comparable to a good restaurant but this is just a food court. What do you expect?  However, the price here I think is comparable to a restaurant and they suggest you pay 15, 18, or 20 percent tips ( maybe not all merchants but the two I tried did ask for tips). Come on, there is no service. You order at the counter and pick up your food by yourself. Why do you ask for tips? This will be my last choice in the future and I would not recommend this place to anybody.

BTW, average per person is probably 10 to 20+ dollars. The $50+ in my review is the total for one adult and two teens.

This place is great! There's so many things to choose from!! I would suggest coming here for a fun night with a group of friends. There's so much to choose from.  Yume has the best sushi and Japanese Curry in town! Itaewon....all I have to say is bulgogi fries!! YUM! Then there's Mochi Donuts...yuuuummm... and then the lemongrass Bahn mi at the Vietnamese stall....just give them all your money. You won't be disappointed
Was disappointed with the quality of food.

Former Kmart garden center. Expensive needs more discount for food and more Asian restaurants from all over Asia. I will use the entry way to get into super gmart. I don't like the idea of putting the rolling gate on near super gmart and the food court area

Great place to get food only if your expecting to eat Asian food.   I don't know why I thought this place would have different ethnic foods.  The prices of food at the restaurants were overrated, especially for our group of family with a bunch of little ones  I would recommend this place for adults. I will go back again to visit the market by myself
Awesome space and so excited finally open! Everything looks soo good. Tried Mujka and Mochinut and both places had great food. Can't wait to come back and explore the other places.
Was good, but I would recommend going early bc a lot of the food was sold out
So excited this food court in Super G mart finally opened. There are many food choices to choose from. From Korean, Thai, Chinese, and Japanese. There's something for everyone.

Go try this place!!! There are so many great options and all the food stalls we tried, everyone was so nice and kind. The first time we went it was grand opening and it was chaotic, I don't think they were prepared for the business but this second time around was perfect. We will def be back to try all the stalls. So excited to have this in Charlotte.

Super cute and fun place to hang out with friends! Go check it out. Some of the food prices are a bit much, others are reasonable , so I'd recommend walking around and trying to find something you each like individually. It's worth a try. The food is delicious from a couple different restaurant kiosks. They have  selfies backdrop walls inside and outside. Super cute.
Looking forward to going again to try the other food options. Some of the restaurants are still not open so we'll have to go visit when they open.

Can't believe this place is finally open! Well worth the long wait because of the assortment of diverse restaurants and great place to hang out. There is a place for little kids to play around, and a place to do Japanese arcade games. The seating is also very convenient. There is also seating outside, and has great photo potential.
Best Korean red curry I've had so far!
Love it!

Alley 51 was just what we were looking for... We had a great time shopping at the G mart and ended our time browsing and sampling a couple of the international restaurants. We will definitely be back to try more!!!
very good food great service and the atmosphere is great there's also a place for the kids
